instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
History; 


Broken display, changed it and it worked for 20 minuts. Now chime CPU is heating but GPu is cold. 

Things i already tried 

- changed <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>
- Reflow <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9650</CHIP>, No change. 


J8300 pins 28-30 0V. 
GPUVcore 0V


No line seems to be shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
No reason to measure J8300, if no GPU VCORE present.
Image MUST appear before the backlight.

Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>; pins 17, 16, 25, 38.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
So GPU VCORE is not even enabled.
Check GPU rail sequencing at page 66...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: <SIGNAL>P1V8GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is missing ans as than all rail go after this one are missing too. I see it is generated by <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. Reflow? Can it be take from any board or it's like SMC and must take it from same board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: Do you get <SIGNAL>GPU_PGOOD1</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: i cant find where ti measure it. There is no component or point on <SIGNAL>GPU_PGOOD1</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: if it's same as <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> than i am getting 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU_FET</SIGNAL> that seems to be same line you are asking me is pulsing to 0.5 V when magsafe connected and than goes down 


P.S: All measerments are made with LCD disconnected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
What's the reason to measure video signals without LCD?
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q8090</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
Check diode mode to ground at =<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU_FET</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q8090</TRANSISTOR>

1,2 - 0V
3 - 3.3V
4-7 - 3.3


Diode mode for <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU_FET</SIGNAL> 0.472


Now LCD is connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: Just have checked with display connected values u asked me before are same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
Missing =<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>?
I supposed to be present, as you said
"<SIGNAL>P1V8GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is missing"
which is next AFTER 3V3GPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is present 3.3V

<SIGNAL>P1V8GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  is missing.

threads.message: Then post <TRANSISTOR>Q8092</TRANSISTOR> voltages.

threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN_L</SIGNAL> - 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: Sorry wrong previous two measerument. I have <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN_L</SIGNAL>  3.3V and <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is present 3.3V
--------------------
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V"
Please...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  is missing. In openboardview when you search for <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  it mark you <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  and <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN_L</SIGNAL> so i measured and got 3.3. 

Here is correct value: 


On <TRANSISTOR>Q8092</TRANSISTOR> 

Pin 3 ( <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN_L</SIGNAL>) is 3.3 V
Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> ) is 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
Did you check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level?
Nothing change if connect external monitor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4V. 


I tried to connect external by HDMI and Thunderbolt nothing changes. 


Usually this models get GPU hot when you turn it on. In my case it's completly cold. Only CPU is heating.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
Why do you expect hot GPU, if doesn't get voltage?
You probably have a problem with <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> now; reball it.
If no result, change it.
Maybe need to change <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
about 9600 it can be taken from 3332 or must be same board like smc?

<CHIP>U9300</CHIP> already changed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9600</CHIP> has firmware and pick it from same model board.
I'm not sure if works from other board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
ok. changed ( reballed left same result. Changed both <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> for second time, but same result


Any other suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
Bad GPU probably...

Do you get <SIGNAL>GMUX_SLP_S3_BUF_L</SIGNAL>?
Check <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> (SYM 3 OF 3) area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>GMUX_SLP_S3_BUF_L</SIGNAL> is present 3.4V


And SYM 3 OF 3 Area cant see anything bad. 


IF GPU is bad why its not powering even if bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
"SYM 3 OF 3 Area cant see anything bad"
Voltage rails and reset good?
Do you get oscillation at Y9600?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DPMUX_UC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>DPMUX_LRESET_L</SIGNAL> 

both 3.3V

About Y9600 cant tell you, dont have osciloscope right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: Should I suppose both power rails OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message: Yes. Both must be 3.3 tha right? If so both are ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image external/Internal
threads.message:
I can only suspect bad GPU.
It has more blocks, apart of CORE.
Some of its blocks should talk with CPU, before GPU VCORE is enabled, I suppose.
Could even be a CPU issue, on the communication side with GPU...
